property.description: Simple HTML5 charts using the canvas element.
The type of chart. Choose from: line, bar, (% class="hljs-string" %)radar(%%), pie,(% class="hljs-string" %) doughnut, polarArea, bubble, scatter.

Advanced options specified as JSON. Checkout the [[Chart.js documentation>>http://www.chartjs.org/docs/latest/]] for the available configuration options. In addition to the options that can be defined in the standard ChartJS library, the following options can be used in this macro: * {{code language="none"}}"opacity": 0.8{{/code}}: makes it possible to define an opacity level for all the background colors. * {{code language="none"}}"backgroundColors": ["#ff16e8", "#0018f4","#065d00"]{{/code}}: for charts of type line, bar, horizontalBar or radar, this option makes it possible to define one background color per data set or one per value, withtout the need to define the colors for each data set individually. * {{code language="none"}}"afterValue": "%"{{/code}}: suffixes the data label values with the given sign or string (e.g. "%", "â‚¬", etc.). * {{code language="none"}}"options.scales.xAxes[0].ticks.afterValue: "%"{{/code}}: (same for yAxes) suffixes the data labels with the given string. * {{code language="none"}}"skipZeros": true{{/code}}: instructs the macro to not display values equalling to 0. * {{code language="none"}}"tooltips": {"maxCharactersPerLine": 50}{{/code}}: in case of long data labels, this option makes it possible to display the full data label in the tooltips, on several lines. * {{code language="none"}}"tooltips": {"position": {"left": 0.5, "bottom": 0.2}}{{/code}}: allows to position the tooltips at a specific position of the canvas computed as the canvas' width or height multiplied by the given value (of "left" or "bottom"). If no value is provided, the "average" positioner is used.
Additional CSS class to be added to the chart container. It can be useful in particular for setting the canvas dimensions at the CSS level.
